subject: Football
lead_paragraph: The former Green Bay Packers receiver Max McGee, who scored the first touchdown in Super Bowl history, was investigated for illegal gambling by the F.B.I. after his career ended, newly released records show. Agents looked into McGee’s activities from late 1972 through September 1973 before dropping the case for lack of evidence, according to records released to The Associated Press under the Freedom of Information Act. McGee died in October.
